Description: DeVry University and its parent company agreed to a $100 million settlement of a Federal Trade Commission lawsuit alleging that they misled prospective students with ads that touted high employment success rates and income levels upon graduation.

Private Litigation Case Title: Gillespie et al v. Devry, Inc.

Description: DeVry Education Group, Inc. agreed to pay $2.75 million to settle an investigation that revealed that DeVry lured students with ads that exaggerated graduates' success in finding employment at graduation and contained inadequately substantiated claims about graduates' salaries.
DeVry agreed to refund $88,122 to resolve a concerning student loans filed by Illinois and New York.
DeVry University agreed to pay $455,000 in settlement of allegations it used deceptive marketing relating to placement rates.
